description.short: Android-based SMIL 3.0 media player for digital signage with custom Rockchip ROM and miX-L CMS integration.
description.full: SMILdroid was an Android-based media player application designed to handle SMIL (Synchronized Multimedia Integration Language) files for digital signage displays. The app enabled synchronized playback of multiple media types (video, images, text) across different screen zones following the SMIL 3.0 standard. As the solo Android developer, I built the application and custom Rockchip Android ROMs for low-cost Android tablets and TV boxes, providing an affordable alternative to expensive dedicated PCs for digital signage. SMILdroid was the playback client for the miX-L Content Management System, allowing central management of remote screens. Introduced in 2012-2013, it was one of the early players to bring open-standard SMIL playback to the Android ecosystem.
